candidate_app.forms module¶

candidate_app.forms.register(request)¶

Handles user registration by rendering a registration form and saving a new user.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object containing metadata about the request.

Returns:

HttpResponse: A response to render the registration form page. Redirect: Redirects to the login page if the registration is successful.

Example:

To register a new user, submit a POST request with ‘username’, ‘password1’, and ‘password2’ to this view.

candidate_app.models module¶

class candidate_app.models.Candidate(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Represents a candidate in the application with basic details.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The candidate’s name, with a maximum length of 100 characters.

  • slogan (str) – The candidate’s campaign slogan, up to 255 characters.

  • bio (str) – A detailed biography of the candidate.

  • description (str, optional) – A short description of the candidate. Defaults to None.

  • votes (int) – The total number of votes the candidate has received. Defaults to 0.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
policies¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class candidate_app.models.Policy(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Represents a policy created by a candidate.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the policy, with a maximum length of 255 characters.

  • description (str) – The content or details of the policy.

  • author (Candidate) – A foreign key referencing the candidate who authored the policy.

  • votes (int) – The total number of votes the policy has received. Defaults to 0.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

author¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

candidate_app.tests module¶

candidate_app.urls module¶

URL configuration for the candidate_app application.

The urlpatterns list routes URLs to the corresponding views within the app. This module defines the structure and routing logic for handling various HTTP requests.

For more information, see Django’s URL dispatcher documentation:

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/5.1/topics/http/urls/

Examples:
Function-based views:

  1. Add an import: from my_app import views

  2. Add a URL to urlpatterns: path(‘’, views.home, name=’home’)

Class-based views:

  1. Add an import: from other_app.views import Home

  2. Add a URL to urlpatterns: path(‘’, Home.as_view(), name=’home’)

Including another URLconf:

  1. Import the include() function: from django.urls import include, path

  2. Add a URL to urlpatterns: path(‘blog/’, include(‘blog.urls’))

Attributes:

app_name (str): The namespace for the candidate_app application. urlpatterns (list): A list of path() instances mapping URLs to their respective views.

candidate_app.views module¶

Handles the primary views of the candidate_app including candidate listing, user authentication, home page display, and voting functionality.

param request:

HttpRequest object representing the HTTP request.

type request:

HttpRequest

param candidate_id:

ID of the candidate (used in views that require it), defaults to None.

type candidate_id:

int, optional

return:

HttpResponse for the respective views.

rtype:

HttpResponse

candidate_app.views.candidate_list(request)¶

Displays a list of candidates. If no candidates are available, shows a default message.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the HTTP request.

Returns:

Renders the candidate list page with candidates and optional message.

Return type:

HttpResponse

candidate_app.views.home_view(request)¶

Displays the home page with a list of candidates.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the HTTP request.

Returns:

Renders the home page with candidate data.

Return type:

HttpResponse

candidate_app.views.logout_view(request)¶

Logs out the user and redirects them to the home page.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the HTTP request.

Returns:

Redirects to the home page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

candidate_app.views.policies(request, candidate_id)¶

Displays the policies for a specific candidate. Allows voting for individual policies if the user is authenticated.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the HTTP request.

  • candidate_id (int) – The ID of the candidate whose policies are displayed.

Returns:

Renders the policies page with candidate and policy data.

Return type:

HttpResponse

candidate_app.views.register(request)¶

Handles user registration. Processes the UserCreationForm and registers a user on success.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the HTTP request.

Returns:

Renders the registration page or redirects to the home page on success.

Return type:

HttpResponse

candidate_app.views.user_login(request)¶

Handles user login. Validates the login form and logs in the user on success.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the HTTP request.

Returns:

Renders the login page or redirects to the home page on successful login.

Return type:

HttpResponse

candidate_app.views.vote(request, candidate_id)¶

Handles voting for a specific candidate. Requires user authentication.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object representing the HTTP request.

  • candidate_id (int) – The ID of the candidate to vote for.

Returns:

Redirects to the home page after voting.

Return type:

HttpResponse
